titocc.compiler

Class Registers

  • java.lang.Object
    • titocc.compiler.Registers

  • public class Registers
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages active and available registers. Active registers are the ones used for current instruction, and there's is always at least one active register, which is used for returning expression's value. Number of active registers can be increased with allocate(). When evaluating subexpressions, active registers containing temporary values can be removed without deallocating them with removeFirst().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Registers()
      Constructs a new register manager that starts with one active register.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFirst()
      Adds back or "reactivates" the register removed by previous call to removeFirst().
      void allocate(Assembler asm)
      Increases the number of currently active registers.
      void deallocate(Assembler asm)
      Decreases the number of active registers by deallocating the register allocated by the previous call to allocate().
      Register get(int idx)
      Returns an active register with the index idx.
      int getActiveRegisterCount()
      Returns the number of active registers.
      void removeFirst()
      Removes the first register from the list of active registers.

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveRegisterCount

        public int getActiveRegisterCount()
        Returns the number of active registers.
        Returns:
        number of activeregisters

      • get

        public Register get(int idx)
        Returns an active register with the index idx. 0 returns the first active register etc.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the active register
        Returns:
        the requested register

      • removeFirst

        public void removeFirst()
        Removes the first register from the list of active registers.

      • addFirst

        public void addFirst()
        Adds back or "reactivates" the register removed by previous call to removeFirst().

      • allocate

        public void allocate(Assembler asm)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Increases the number of currently active registers. If there are not enough available registers, then pushes one of the reserved registers to stack and it will be added as the last to available registers.
        Parameters:
        asm - assembler used for emitting the push instruction
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if assembler throws

      • deallocate

        public void deallocate(Assembler asm)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Decreases the number of active registers by deallocating the register allocated by the previous call to allocate(). If allocate() pushed a register to stack, then popRegister will emit the corresponding pop instruction and remove the register from available registers.
        Parameters:
        asm - assembler used for emitting the pop instruction
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if assembler throws
